page.title: 03FARMS - CASTLE HEDINGHAM
page.content: Farms in the area tend to be large arable ones in keeping with East Anglia. The main crops are wheat for milling or feed, barley for malting or feed, and a break crop of sugar beet, beans or oil seed rape. Beef cattle are kept on some of the farms to use the cereals. Much of the cereal crop is sold to the EEC to be stored in Intervention Sheds as there is too much on the market. Chickens grown to about 2kg. are produced on one farm. 15000 day-old chicks are reared and brought to weight in about 7 weeks. 6 batches are produced in a year. There is only one dairy farm. This has 50 fresian cows with 50 followers. A penalty of 10p a litre is imposed by the Government if the quota of milk is exceeded. Cream is produced to use the excess milk.
